summary: Ida Jane Ross is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll certification reports from February 1977 to January 1978, indicating her employment with the committee during that period. The documents list her name, social security number, and salary, confirming her role as a staff member. The payroll certifications serve as administrative records of her employment and compensation during the HSCA's investigation.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ida Jane Ross's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the administrative functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of her duties is not detailed in the provided documents, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the committee's operations.
